full_text: 1676. Geo. D. Barnird & Co., Blank Book Manufacturers, Lithographers and Stationers, St. Louis, Mo. [$1 per doz.] f UNITED STATES. OF. AMERICA. THE STATE OF TEXAS, district COURT, County of Hannis February Term, A. D. 1892 At a Term of the District Court, held in and for the County of Famine in the City of Benham, an the day of march in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and ninet two Present the Honorable E. D. mebbellan gridge Sixth Ejuciciae District Be it Remembered, That on the said day personally appeared in open Court josef Tires , an alien, and subject of the Empiran of Austria and made application to be admitted a citizen of the UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, and in support of his said application, he produced to the Court the declarations, on oath, of bhas Yearsell and m J. young both citizens of the UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, that said Josef Tires has resided within the limits and jurisdiction of the UNITED STATES OF AMERICA for more th five years last past, and the etc year thereof within the STATE OF TEXAS: that during that time he has behaved as a man of good moral character, attached to the principles of the Constitution of the UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, and well disposed to the good order and happiness of the same, and the said Josef Linco having shoun to the satisfaction of this Courd that he has faithfully complied with all the requirements of the Naturalization Laros of the United States Congress, and is entitled to the benefits of the same, and he having also made oath of record in this Court that he will support the Constitution of the United States of America, and that he doth absolutely and entirely renounce and abjure all allegiance and fidelity to any foreign Prince, Rotentate, State or @overeignty whatever, and particularly to the Empires of Austria of whom he was a subject. was therefore Ordered by the Sourt, That the said Josef Lirab be admitted and he was admitted to be A CITIZEN OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA. WITNESS, C. H. white Clerk of the said Court. I.N' TESTIMONT WHEREOF, I have hereunto set my hand and affixed the Seal of the District Court, at the City of Banham this 5th day of march in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and ninety and of the Independence of the United States of America, the One Hormania and Sixteenth L.H.White Clerk of the Destrict Court of Transic Co., Texas. By Deputy.
